name: Hawaiian Iced Tea
author: QueenofSuburbs
summary: I first tasted this tea in a popular Italian restaurant in my college hometown of Kailua. I have been craving it ever since, and have experimented with a few proportions. Add more tea leaves for a stronger tea, but do not steep longer or the tea will end up tasting bitter. (If it does, add a pinch of baking soda.) Always make something to your liking! This is also great to serve at showers.
ingredients: 1  fresh pineapple - peeled, cored, and cut into spears
directions: Pour the barely boiling hot water into a large pitcher, and add the tea bags
Remove the tea bags and pour in the ice water
Refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, about 1 1/2 hours
Pour the tea over ice, garnish with pineapple spears, and serve
